pair.question: Enthalpy of combusion is the enthalpy change when...
pair.answer: one mole of the substance is completely burnt, with all reactants and products in their standard states.

pair.question: The molar heat of vaporisation is the energy required to change...
pair.answer: one mole of the substance from a liquid to a gas at its boiling point.

pair.question: Entropy is...
pair.answer: the quantity that measures the amount of disorder in a system

pair.question: The enthalpy of formation is the enthalpy change when...
pair.answer: one mole of the substance is formed from its elements, with all reactants and products in their standard states.

pair.question: Temperature...
pair.answer: is proportional to the average kinetic energy of the particles.

pair.question: The molar heat of fusion is the energy required to change...
pair.answer: one mole of the substance from a solid to a liquid at its melting point.

pair.question: Heat...
pair.answer: is the sum of the kinetic energies of all the particles in a sample.

pair.question: Hess's law: the enthalpy change of a given chemical reaction...
pair.answer: depends only on the states of the reactants and products and not on the way the reaction proceeds.

pair.question: A spontaneous process is...
pair.answer: a rearrangement of particles from a less probable state to a more probable one.

pair.question: The specific heat capacity is the amount of heat energy required...
pair.answer: to raise the temperature of one gram of the substance by one degree.
